alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau; Western Uintah Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 16 at 1:57PM MDT until June 17 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR DRY THUNDERSTORMS...WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 482 AND 484 BELOW 6500 FEET... The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a Red Flag Warning below 6500 feet for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 10 PM MDT Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 482 Western Uintah Basin and Fire Weather Zone 484 Tavaputs Plateau. * WINDS...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to widely scattered dry thunderstorms are possible Friday. Strong and erratic outflow winds are possible. * IMPACTS...Critical fire weather conditions will occur. Any new fire starts or existing fires may spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
